name: New Orleans Downtown Marriott at the Convention Center

reviews.text: My friends and I decided to take a trip to New Orleans, being how I've never been. We booked this hotel through priceline for $60 and when we got there rooms were selling for $209 a night!!( plus an additional $35 charge for parking, which is ridiculous!) The room was very clean and modern. We had a room with two beds and they were very small, not sure we could've fit two ppl in one bed! The only thing I didn't like was the pool was really small and closed at 10pm, to me that was odd since it is New Orleans, ppl are up all night!! They have room service and a pretty good menu, if you don't mind paying $7 for mac-N-cheese! I had to pass. Overall this is great hotel and I would stay here again.
reviews.title: wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed Fri to Sun and were a little worried about the location away from the "main action". Door guys met us at the car the moment we arrived and were amazing the entire visit. Our room was beautiful, clean and quiet but we had not received the requested fridge. I called the desk to ask if it was possible and a fridge arrived within 15 minutes. The bedding is top of the line luxurious and rooms have flat screen tv's with cabinets storing drawers and the coffee makers. The staff was absolutely amazing with Good Morning and Good Afternoon and How can we help you ..everytime we passed the lobby. I cannot rave enough! Their ATM was broken but they desk gave directions to the nearest ATM and suggested a restuarant that we have fallen in love with! Daisy Dukes is now a must visit! As for the location - Harrahs was a 4.50 cab ride and the streetcar was 2 blocks away...very easy to navigate from here.2 Trips this year and I'm still amazed at the hospitality of NOLA after Katrina...such a wonderful and historical, fun place!
reviews.title: Wonderful!!! Wow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved it, we were there for three nights, front desk staff and bartenders were wonderful. Our room was very clean and comfortable. Nice lobby, guys at the door were very friendly and always ready to help. We reserved this hotel thru despegar.com, this hotel was selling for US$189.00 and this website had it for US$84.00 what a great value!!!! We will definitely use this website again.
reviews.title: Owesome

reviews.text: I got my reservations at the Marriot Convention Center Hotel through a bid. After being satisfied greatly that I was getting four star accomodations at a great price, I viewed the picutures posted on line for this hotel. It now way prepared me for the beauty, and sophisticated charm that we were about to behold. We only live forty five minutes from New Orleans and I needed two rooms for one night for my two daughters, one son and four young grandchildren. Our accomodations were pristine, beautifully decorated and everything worked. The staff was friendly, well trained, and effective in extending the comfort of a fine property. Parking was pricey, Valet service was available for $30.00. It is pretty conviently located and the view, may I say, was spactacular. Staying at down town hotels in the city causes your view of the city to be somewhat minimal because of the many tall buildings. We got to view the city from our room and my grandchildren were in awe. They just sat with me and gazed at all the sited. I must hail this property for their lovely and very plush bedding, fine linens and comfortable and abundant pillows. It was our first stay where we didn't march through the lobby with all of our personal pillows and I am glad we could leave that load at home!
reviews.title: Amazing value and superb quality!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Marriott Convention Center. In the guest services directory it indicates they have a continental breakfast from 6:30 am to 10:00 am. Went down to the service desk to inquire where it was. Was told they don't offer a continental breakfast. Marriott should update their guest services directory they put in your room with accurate information. They told us we could eat dinner in the restaurant they had in the hotel. What a joke -- $18.00 for breakfast!!!! We passed.
reviews.title: Marriott's is not honest.

reviews.text: Hotel was super clean. Beds and pillows fabulous! When we checked in, we were put in a double room but had reserved a king. I called the front desk and they immediately found us a king room on the same floor.
reviews.title: Great visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking is expensive ($31 + tax a day) but valets were very friendly and quick. Right across from street from riverfront/shopping area. It is a long walk to French Quarter. This is more of a business hotel. There are great restaurants within walking distance. We ate at Mulate's for lunch and Grand Isle for dinner. Both were great. Starbucks in the lobby!
reviews.title: nice room, bad location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: hotel had very nice & clean rooms, the staff was friendly...but location was a long walk from french quarter & not sure about late night safety along the way. parking expensive & slow.
reviews.title: Hated to Leave this Hotel!!

reviews.text: From the time we parked our car out front to check in, to the time we got in our car to leave, this hotel was fabulous! The valet guys were always polite and very helpful, the front desk employees were so friendly you would have thought we have known each other for years! The rooms were clean, fresh and very comfortable! I didn't want to get out of those beds! The bathrooms were very clean! They were a host hotel for the Jazz Half Marathon and all employees were informed and had information when needed. The only thing negative I can say is the cost of valet parking was a bit high at $31.00 plus some taxes (ended up $38.00). I would definitely recommend this hotel. Just wish I had more time to spend and enjoy the whole atmosphere of this hotel. It is close to everything you need to see in New Orleans. I would go back in a heartbeat!!!
reviews.title: Except for a few nits, a great hotel

reviews.text: I attended/spoke at a conference that was held at the Marriott Convention Center and decided to stay on site. My husband joined me at the end of the conference for a weekend in NOLA and we continued the stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Great spot

reviews.text: Location is good. Help is attentive. DO NOT STAY IN ROOM 1517. There is an air handling unit of some sort in an adjoining room that caused loud noise and vibrations in the room.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: I was moved to room 1527 and everything there was fine.
reviews.title: No room at the inn

reviews.text: Despite having reservations and a confirmation number I was told when I got to my hotel they did not have a room for me. I was not even afforded the courtesy of a phone call. They did book me in another property far from where I needed to be. Just when I thought it could not get worse the hotel was under construction. Wish I could share these pictures I am looking at a series of toilets ready to be installed. Shame on you Marriott your in the hospitality business
reviews.title: Average but I would stay here again.

reviews.text: Across the board I give this Marriott an average rating compared to others I have stayed with. Very clean and comfortable beds. I was here for a convention. I did not get the room I paid for on the concierges level with a kind room. Instead it was a double, with the bed so close to the entry that you had to dodge to keep from banging knees. I stayed in the room though because the view was fantastic and nothing was left on the level I asked for. The showers were not as hot as I like them and the pressure was weak. The staff is laid back and super nice. If there were 10 stars for the staff I would give it to them. I did have entry to the concierges lounge which by far is the best one in any Marriott worldwide that I have been in. Very clean, nice staff and the fresh yogurt with granola was delicious. The bar drinks and food were ok but don't waste your time here. Head out to the French Quarter.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel with Mediocre Service

reviews.text: I liked the location safe, secure and found it a good spot to the French Quarter but rather expensive. For the 4 days at this hotel, my trip expense was more than my 3 week vacation in Europe. Seriously, this was outrageous.
reviews.title: Superior Service!!!

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel with a convention, and all of our meetings were held at this location. We were able to walk to most of the local attractions (Bourbon Street, Harrah's, etc.). Rooms are pleasantly decorated and seem updated and clean. This hotel has two towers, and I didn't see any real advantage to one over the other - views appear the same, same distance to get to hotel amenities, etc. There is a restaurant on the lobby level, which has slightly better than average food, but the menu is pretty limited (and it's at hotel lobby prices - expensive). There were constantly lines at the front desk, but I know the hotel was sold out and very busy with the convention there. The elevators took me a minute to figure out, but they are quite efficient, which is great because during a convention with a sold out hotel I would normally expect to wait, but the wait times were usually quite short. During my visit I requested my room be cleaned at a certain time, and they complied with that. There is a full Starbucks in the lobby. The trolley is right outside the hotel, and taxis are plentiful out front as well - but we pretty much walked everywhere as a group. One side of the hotel has a river view, if that's your thing. I had city views, which is fine for me. This is a tall hotel - can't remember how many floors, but I usually request a high floor to stay away from city sounds. However, this usually means that if the elevator is packed, I have to endure many stops before getting to my floor - but their elevator system seems to help with that considerably. If you're looking to plan a business meeting, I highly recommend this hotel. Meeting rooms were nice, the service was good, and it was extremely convenient. All in all, a nice stay.
reviews.title: Convenient, pleasant, great for business meetings

reviews.text: I love good customer service and it's top shelf at this property from every single employee you come in contact with. Kudos. Great value for cruise package...room, wonderful breakfast and parking during cruise. Only downside was the noise and housekeeping coming in while sleeping. Will be back for a conference in 2012.
reviews.title: Excellent customer service

reviews.text: I typically love staying at Marriott's when traveling for business, because they are usually very good at providing a standard level of service.
reviews.title: Close to the convention center

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay

reviews.text: This hotel was right across from the convention center, had a Starbucks in the lobby, was within walking distance to the Riverwalk mall, and had pretty quick room service. Their concierge lounge had a nice variety of food at dinner. They only had water and sodas in the fridge (other lounges have juice as well), and did not serve alcoholic beverages.
reviews.title: Rooms are Variable

description: Discover a riverfront New Orleans Hotel in the energetic Arts District, minutes away from the area’s top attractions such as the French Quarter, Harrah’s Casino, Cruise Port and a multitude of dining & entertainment options. Housed in a renovated 19th century cotton mill, the Marriott hotel in New Orleans near the convention center boasts over 300 spacious rooms & suites, offering guests a refreshing night of rest. Experience an abundance of New Orleans convention hotel amenities including a fitness center, Starbucks Coffee Shop, business center and rooftop swimming pool. Indulge in regional Creole cuisine at Wolfe’s in the Warehouse, or unwind in the Wine Bar with your favorite cocktail. With over 25,000 square feet of flexible function space, this innovative New Orleans convention center hotel is ideal for both intimate gatherings & large corporate events. Plan your next stay at the Marriott, a premier hotel near the New Orleans convention center featuring impeccable service in a welcoming atmosphere.
